text: thumb|Moon photo with the Seas and Impact Craters labeled This is a list of maria (large, dark, basaltic plains) on the Moon. It includes other basaltic plains, including the one oceanus as well as features known by the names lacus, palus and sinus. The modern system of lunar nomenclature was introduced in 1651 by Giovanni Battista Riccioli. Riccioli's map of the Moon was drawn by Francesco Maria Grimaldi, who has a crater named after him. ==Maria and Oceanus== {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Lunar Maria |- ! Latin Name ! English Name ! Lat. ! Long. ! |align="right"| 65.1° E |align="right"| 139 |- | Mare Tranquillitatis | Sea of Tranquility |align="right"| 8.5° N |align="right"| 31.4° E |align="right"| 873 |- | Mare Undarum | Sea of Waves |align="right"| 6.8° N |align="right"| 68.4° E |align="right"| 243 |- | Mare Vaporum | Sea of Vapors |align="right"| 13.3° N |align="right"| 3.6° E |align="right"| 245 |- | Oceanus Procellarum | Ocean of Storms |align="right"| 18.4° N |align="right"| 57.4° W |align="right"| 2568 |} There was also a region on the Lunar farside that was briefly misidentified as a mare and named Mare Desiderii (Sea of Desire). It is no longer recognized. Other former maria include: *Mare Parvum ("Small Sea"), immediately to the east of Inghirami *Mare Incognitum ("Unknown Sea") *Mare Novum ("New Sea"), northeast of Plutarch *Mare Struve ("Struve's Sea"), near Messala ==Lacus== A related set of features are the Lunar lacus (singular also lacus, Latin for "lake"),In Latin, the singular is lacus and the plural is lacūs , but they are spelled and pronounced the same in English. which are smaller basaltic plains of similar origin: {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Lunar Lacus |- ! Latin Name ! English Name ! Lat. ! Long. ! 38.8° S |align="right"| 27.3° W |align="right"| 117 |- | Lacus Veris | Lake of Spring |align="right"| 16.5° S |align="right"| 86.1° W |align="right"| 396 |} ==Sinus and Paludes== A related set of features are the sinus (singular sinus, Latin for "bay")As with 'lacus', Latin sg. sinus and plural sinūs are spelled and pronounced the same in English and paludes (singular palus , Latin palūs, palūdēs "marsh"): {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Lunar Sinus and Paludes |- ! Latin Name ! English Name ! Lat. ! Long. ! Diameter (km) |- | Palus Epidemiarum | Marsh of Epidemics |align="right"| 32.0° S |align="right"| 28.2° W |align="right"| 286 |- | Palus Putredinis | Marsh of Decay |align="right"| 26.5° N |align="right"| 0.4° E |align="right"| 161 |- | Palus Somni | Marsh of Sleep |align="right"| 14.1° N |align="right"| 45.0° E |align="right"| 143 |- | Sinus Aestuum | Seething Bay |align="right"| 10.9° N |align="right"| 8.8° W |align="right"| 290 |- | Sinus Amoris | Bay of Love |align="right"| 18.1° N |align="right"| 39.1° E |align="right"| 130 |- | Sinus Asperitatis | Bay of Roughness |align="right"| 3.8° S |align="right"| 27.4° E |align="right"| 206 |- | Sinus Concordiae | Bay of Harmony |align="right"| 10.8° N |align="right"| 43.2° E |align="right"| 142 |- | Sinus Fidei | Bay of Trust |align="right"| 18.0° N |align="right"| 2.0° E |align="right"| 70 |- | Sinus Honoris | Bay of Honor |align="right"| 11.7° N |align="right"| 18.1° E |align="right"| 109 |- | Sinus Iridum | Bay of Rainbows |align="right"| 44.1° N |align="right"| 31.5° W |align="right"| 236 |- | Sinus Lunicus | Lunik Bay |align="right"| 31.8° N |align="right"| 1.4° W |align="right"| 126 |- | Sinus Medii | Bay of the center |align="right"| 2.4° N |align="right"| 1.7° E |align="right"| 335 |- | Sinus Roris | Bay of Dew |align="right"| 54.0° N |align="right"| 56.6° W |align="right"| 202 |- | Sinus Successus | Bay of Success |align="right"| 0.9° N |align="right"| 59.0° E |align="right"| 132 |} Some sources also list a Palus Nebularum (Latin palūs nebulārum "Marsh of Mists") at 38.0° N, 1.0° E. However the designation for this feature has not been officially recognized by the IAU. ==See also== * List of craters on the Moon * List of features on the Moon * List of mountains on the Moon * List of valleys on the Moon * Selenography ==References== * L. E. Andersson and Ewen A. Whitaker, NASA Catalogue of Lunar Nomenclature, NASA RP-1097, 1982, no ISBN. * Ben Bussey and Paul Spudis, The Clementine Atlas of the Moon, Cambridge University Press, 2004, . * Antonín Rükl, Atlas of the Moon, Kalmbach Books, 1990, . * Ewen A. Whitaker, Mapping and Naming the Moon, Cambridge University Press, 1999, . ==External links== *NASA lunar Atlas * Digital Lunar Orbiter Photographic Atlas of the Moon * USGS: Moon nomenclature * USGS: Moon Nomenclature: Mare * USGS: Moon Nomenclature: Oceanus * USGS: Moon Nomenclature: Lacus * USGS: Moon Nomenclature: Palus * USGS: Moon Nomenclature: Sinus Category:Astronomy- related lists Category:Moon-related lists
title: List of maria on the Moon
